item.title: Cinco de Mayo Burrito
item.description: This weekend was Cinco de Mayo. On that day in 1862, a small Mexican Army defeated a large French Army. Another way of looking at it is that it's the celebration of an underdog overcoming an unsurmountable titan. You have to be abnormal. Do the unexpected. Think outside of the
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
This weekend was Cinco de Mayo. On that day in 1862, a small Mexican Army defeated a large French Army. Another way of looking at it is that it's the celebration of an underdog overcoming an unsurmountable titan. You have to be abnormal. Do the unexpected. Think outside of the known. In order to overcome what is thought to be impossible. This recipe very much represents that, in my mind I was going to create an average burrito until I added the hash brown. #goldenhashbrowns

Ingredients
  • Shredded chicken
  • Corn
  • Spinach
  • Mushroom
  • 1/2 Avocado
  • Whole wheat burrito wrap
  • Cucmumber
  • Hash Brown
  • Vegetable Oil
  • Seasoning (Salt, Pepper)
Prep & Directions
  1. Boil the corn till tender
  2. Shred some chicken from stop and shop
  3. Slice up the mushrooms
  4. Add a bit of vegetable oil and stir fry the mushrooms
  5. Add in the spinach
  6. Add in the chicken
  7. Ask your sister to slice an avocado
  8. Ask your sister to slice the hot corn. Look at her technique!
  9. Pan fry a hash brown just because you're craving it
  10. Warm up the wrap.
  11. Plate it!
Bon Appetit

Marley has to eat when you eat.

item.title: ðŸ¥‘ Toasty Avocuddle
item.description:
A wise man once said when everything seems like shit, just think of avocados ðŸ¥‘ðŸ¥‘ðŸ¥‘

Avocado already tastes amazing alone. But sometimes cuddling it up with few other ingredients can give you a feeling you'll never forget. Add pumpkin seeds, arugula and cherry tomatoes for a nutty and sweet sensation.

Ingredients
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
A wise man once said when everything seems like shit, just think of avocados ðŸ¥‘ðŸ¥‘ðŸ¥‘

Avocado already tastes amazing alone. But sometimes cuddling it up with few other ingredients can give you a feeling you'll never forget. Add pumpkin seeds, arugula and cherry tomatoes for a nutty and sweet sensation.

Ingredients
  • 1 Really Good Thick Bread
  • 1/2 Ripe Avocado
  • 2 Eggs (optional)
  • Sliced Turkey (optional)
  • Arugula
  • Pumpkin Seeds
  • Chia Seeds
  • Cherry Tomatos
Prep & Directions
  1. Get the bread toasty and golden
  2. Cook the egg over easy so that yolk will fall all over you
  3. Heat the turkey and tomato
  4. Admire the avocado
  5. Smash the avocado
  6. Spread the avocado evenly over the toast. Then sprinkle some chia seeds and pumpkin seeds.
  7. Add arugula and tomato
  8. Add egg and turkey
Bon Appetit

This is literally me at the store:

item.title: My 2018 Goals
item.description:
"Without a goal you can't score"

Everyone is a work in progress. No one is perfect and everyone can improve. Having goals helps you progress towards that person you want to be. It shows that you are aware of yourself. It prevents you from getting too comfortable.

Last
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
"Without a goal you can't score"

Everyone is a work in progress. No one is perfect and everyone can improve. Having goals helps you progress towards that person you want to be. It shows that you are aware of yourself. It prevents you from getting too comfortable.

Last year I focused on creating a foundation of mental toughness and getting into physical shape. I got to travel to several places, run my first marathon, teach kids, focus less on other people's opinions...

This year I want to focus on consistency and learning.

Mental

  • Mediate daily
  • Disconnect, reflect and plan weekly
  • Read 10 books
  • Sleep earlier and wake up earlier

Physical

  • Run three marathons (NYC, CHI, SF)
  • Run a marathon under 4 hours
  • Join a running club
  • Stretch daily

Personal

  • Obtain my driver license
  • Improve my Chinese
  • Apply to graduate school
  • Teach Marley a new trick

Creative

  • Blog twice a month
  • Create and upload 5 videos
  • Redesign room
  • Take weekend trips outside of NYC

item.title: A Sweet Side Without The BS
item.description: Growing up my mom was very strict when it came to eating junk food. There was never any candy in the house and if there was, we would only be allowed one piece. I remember times on my way home from school and I would stop by the grocery store
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
Growing up my mom was very strict when it came to eating junk food. There was never any candy in the house and if there was, we would only be allowed one piece. I remember times on my way home from school and I would stop by the grocery store to buy a 25 cent pack of chips or chocolate. I would stuff my face in it and then throw the wrapper in the trash can outside the house before heading into the house. Then a few days later when my mom took out the trash, she find out that I had eaten some junk food and scold at me. So I got smarter and hid the wrapper at the bottom of the trash bag.

Looking back at it now, I'm thankful for my mom's persistence when it came to junk food. I never had cavities. I never developed a sweet tooth. I have a healthily diet 90% of the time. In fact, I don't even like candy anymore unless it's dark chocolate.

If you crave something sweet, baked sweet potato fries if your best friend. It's healthy and has many benefits which I don't know about but I'm sure you know how to use the internet. Add a side of avocado and you'll start to wonder why candy even exist at all.

Ingredients (2 servings or 1 if you are selfish)
  • 1 Sweet Potato
  • 1 Avocado
  • Oil
  • Seasoning (Salt, Pepper)
Prep & Directions
  1. You should wash the sweet potato cause it's been in the dirt for a while
  2. Peel the sweet potato
  3. Cut into 1 cm slices.
  4. Cut into 1 cm sticks
  5. Wash and drain for a few minutes. This is to get rid of the starch.
  6. Dry
  7. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil and mix.
  8. Plate them on a rack
  9. Bake for 40-50 minutes at 400 degrees. Half way into baking, flip the sweet potato so it can get crispy all over.
  10. Smash up a full avocado for the spread
  11. Plate it and share
Bon Appetit

All good things come in moderation. Thanks Mom!

item.title: Hot Salmon Dynamite
item.description: Aloha! I was inspired to make the salmon dynamite when I was in Hawaii last month. It's like a mini sushi burrito stuffed with salmon, crab meat and savory spicy mayo sauce. If you have ever been to Hawaii you'll notice many 7-Eleven's. Typically when I think of 7-Eleven food,
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
Aloha! I was inspired to make the salmon dynamite when I was in Hawaii last month. It's like a mini sushi burrito stuffed with salmon, crab meat and savory spicy mayo sauce. If you have ever been to Hawaii you'll notice many 7-Eleven's. Typically when I think of 7-Eleven food, I think of unhealthy gas station food that you have to buy because there's nothing better to eat around. 7-Eleven food in Hawaii on the other hand have asian snacks and Hawaiian style dishes!

Ingredients (2 servings)
  • Salmon
  • Crabmeat
  • Avocado (Preferred) or Spinach
  • Rice
  • Seaweed
  • Oil
  • Seasoning (Salt, Pepper)
Prep & Directions
  1. Wash and slice the salmon into 1 inch pieces
  2. Season with salt and pepper
  3. Put the pan on medium heat and add a bit of oil
  4. When the pan is hot enough add the salmon. Cook until tender.
  5. While the salmon is cooking, add the spinach to the pan. Cook until tender.
  6. Rip the crabmeat into stringy pieces and cook in the pan until hot.
  7. Rip the cooked salmon into small pieces.
  8. Prep the bamboo roller by wrapping it in plastic. This is to prevent the roller from getting dirty.
  9. First place the seaweed onto the roller then spread the rice evenly on the seaweed. Make sure to put a thin layer of rice.
  10. Add the salmon layered with the crabmeat, make sure it takes up 1 inch of space. On the next level add the spinach.
  11. Roll it up!
  12. Cut in half.
  13. Add spicy mayo if you like.
Bon Appetit

Be sure to share.

item.title: Soy Saucy Salmon
item.description:
Persistence trumps all

"Fish makes you smarter" said my mom, as she places a piece of fish over my rice. My sister and I would chuckle as we knew there was no way eating fish would increase your IQ. As a child, every other day we would have
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
Persistence trumps all

"Fish makes you smarter" said my mom, as she places a piece of fish over my rice. My sister and I would chuckle as we knew there was no way eating fish would increase your IQ. As a child, every other day we would have fish on the table for dinner and every time she would tell us to eat the fish before she had some for herself. Did we end up smarter? Probably, not due to eating fish but because my mom's persistence and belief in eating fish that led us to work harder in our studies and raised our IQ by a point or two although IQ is a meaningless way to judge a person's intellect. It is also that persistence that led me to fall in love with seafood.

It's pouring outside today in NYC, it hasn't rained this hard in months. A perfect day for eating hot salmon. We will be making salmon using my mom's technique: steaming. Yea, it's that simple that my dog can make it. It's also healthy compared to fried salmon which is another way of cooking it. When you cook fish, the sauce is the second most important part besides cooking the fish right. The reason is that fish has a fishy smell (no duh), it's important for the sauce to overcome the fishy smell so your breath doesn't stick afterwards. The sauce contains soy sauce, ginger and scallion cause it's the typical asian seasoning then adding a few tomatoes because soy sauce is salty so the sweet tomatoes will balance out the sauce. On to the recipe!

Ingredients (2 servings)
  • 1 salmon
  • 1 tbsp sliced ginger
  • 2 sliced scallion
  • 2 tbsp light soy sauce
  • 1/4 tbsp dark soy sauce
  • 2 tomatoes grapes
Prep & Directions
  1. Wash and dry the salmon. Make sure the salmon is tucked in.
  2. Add water to a pan on high heat.
  3. Slice the ginger, scallion and tomato.
  4. Place the salmon on a plate and add the light & dark soy sauce. Add the seasoning.
  5. When the water is boiling add the salmon to the pan.
  6. Salmon is very delicate! It's important to not overcook the salmon or it will taste like a piece of wood! Use a chopstick to check if the salmon is done. Around 10-15 minutes is the expected time for the salmon to cook.
  7. Plate it!
Bon Appetit

Top it off with a side of rice and boy choy. Eat up and let me know if you got any smarter.

item.title: Oven Baked Soy Garlic Chicken
item.description:
Sometimes you just need a spark to continue from where you left off

It's been a while since my last post. I slept past
hibernation season... Ok here goes nothing:

Yesterday night I had a late night dinner at Mad For Chicken, I was reminded of what amazing fried chicken
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes you just need a spark to continue from where you left off

It's been a while since my last post. I slept past
hibernation season... Ok here goes nothing:

Yesterday night I had a late night dinner at Mad For Chicken, I was reminded of what amazing fried chicken tastes like. It was sooooo good that my sister and I had the leftovers for breakfast. However it did not satisfy my craving so I knew I had to make it for lunch!

One slight twist is instead of frying the chicken, we will be baking it because I didn't plan on running another 9 miles today and you shouldn't too.

Ingredients (2 servings)
  • 8 Chicken Wings
  • 1 Broccoli Bunch (Optional)
  • 1 Egg
  • Some Potato Starch
  • 1 tbsp Minced Ginger
  • 4 Garlic Cloves
  • 1 tbsp Sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp Honey
  • 1 tbsp Chili Oil
  • 3 tbsp Soy Sauce
  • Seasoning (Salt, Pepper, Chili Powder)
  • Rice (Optional)
Prep + Directions
  1. Wash the chicken
  2. Cut the chicken into a wing and a drumette. Cut the cartilage and not the bone so it's easier to separate.
  3. Season the chicken with salt, pepper and chili powder
  4. Scramble an egg and mix it with the chicken. The egg will help the potato starch stick!
  5. Mix! Mix! Mix!
  6. Roll the chicken in potato starch and place it onto a baking rack. The potato starch will add a slight crispy-ness to the chicken.
  7. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F
  8. Add the chicken into the oven for 25 minutes. Flip the chicken at the half way point (sounds like the nike running app notifying you are almost done with your run lol).
  9. Onto the sauce! Cut up the garlic and ginger into tiny pieces. Now mix it with the soy sauce (dark + light preferably), honey and chili oil.
  10. On low heat, cook the sauce for 30 seconds the pour back into the bowl. This will thicken the sauce so that it will the coat the chicken easily additionally it will bring out the flavor of the garlic. Watch your nose, the chili oil will make your nose tingle.
  11. Next boil some broccoli so we can balance out the dish and feel good eating a but unhealthly.
  12. Once the chicken is ready, place the chicken onto a pan on low heat. Pour the sauce.
  13. Stir well
  14. Plate it!
Bon Appetit

Hands down this is way better than mad for chicken from the simple fact that whenever you make something with your bare hands it always tastes better than the real thing. My sister gave this a 8/10. I gave her a 10/10 for eating every piece of meat off the chicken wings.

item.title: Orange You Hungry For Chipotle
item.description:
Today my sister wanted me to buy Chipotle for lunch. Well actually, more like every weekend she wants me to buy lunch for her. I told her I could make a better chipotle than chipotle. She didn't think so. #challengeAccepted

The colors that this dish brings out is perfect for
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
Today my sister wanted me to buy Chipotle for lunch. Well actually, more like every weekend she wants me to buy lunch for her. I told her I could make a better chipotle than chipotle. She didn't think so. #challengeAccepted

The colors that this dish brings out is perfect for the fall! We will replacing the salad/green peppers for asparagus and mushrooms. The beans will be replaced by sweet potatoes for some orange autumn color and sweet moist taste. Warning this recipe might take a while, grab a drink and popcorn.

Ingredients
  • 1 Chicken Thigh (it's juicier than chicken breasts)
  • 1 Sweet Corn
  • 1/2 of Sweet Potato
  • 1 Handful of Asparagus
  • 1 Handful of Mushrooms
  • 1/2 of Avocado (my avocado was still hard so I used mozzarella cheese)
  • 1 Cup of Asian Jasmine Rice (or for a healthier option use brown rice)
  • 1 Cup of Water
  • Olive oil
  • Seasoning (Salt, Pepper, Chili Powder)
Prep
  1. Wash all ingredients.
  2. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Directions
  1. Add the rice and water into a rice cooker.
  2. Peel and dice the sweet potato into cubes. Toss in bowl with olive oil and seasoning. Place the potatoes on a tray and into the oven for 30 minutes.
  3. Add water to pot and bring to a boil. Add the corn to the pot and boil for 15 minutes.
  4. Peel the ends of the asparagus and cut 1 inch slices.
  5. Slice and dice the mushrooms into cubes.
  6. Add olive oil to a hot pan. Add in the asparagus and mushrooms with seasoning. Stir fry till cooked.
  7. Remove all fat from the chicken thigh. Add seasoning. Add a little bit of olive oil to a hot pan. Cook till tender then slice into cubes.
  8. Plate it!
Bon Appetit

My sister said she will never buy chipotle again after eating this!

item.title: Creamy Chicken Sandwich
item.description: The classic chicken sandwich. I eat chicken sandwiches all time and combined with different ingredients you can make a variety of chicken sandwiches. This chicken sandwich recipe has mozzarella and avocado which will give your taste buds a creamy and moist feeling. It is quick, easy to cook and healthy
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
The classic chicken sandwich. I eat chicken sandwiches all time and combined with different ingredients you can make a variety of chicken sandwiches. This chicken sandwich recipe has mozzarella and avocado which will give your taste buds a creamy and moist feeling. It is quick, easy to cook and healthy because it has vegetables!

Ingredients
  • 6 inch baguette (I prefer French bread but Italian bread works as well :D)
  • 1 Chicken breast
  • 1 Slice of mozzarella
  • 1/4 Green pepper
  • 1/3 Avocado
  • Handful of spinach (or salad)
  • Seasoning (salt, pepper, chili powder)
  • Tablespoon of olive oil
Prep
  1. Slice green pepper & avocado into slices
  2. Slice baguette in half
  3. Season the chicken
Directions
  1. Heat up the pan and add a tablespoon of olive oil.
  2. When the pan is hot, place the chicken into the pan. Be sure to flip it around.
  3. When the chicken is about cooked then add the mozzarella on top until melted.
  4. Toast the baguette.
  5. Place the chicken with melted mozzarella, avocado, spinach and green peppers on the baguette.
Bon Appetit

If the sandwich looks too green add a slice of tomato. :)

item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
UPDATE: I DID IT! I've ran my first marathon in Hawaii on 12/10/17.

Stopped updating this after a month...

Race Log

August 20, 2016 | NYCRUNS Governors Island 5K: 8:56/M
September 25, 2016 | NYCRUNS Squirrel Stampede 10K: 9:00/M
November 12, 2016 | NYCRUNS Falling Leaves 10K: TBD

Running Log
September 11, 2016:
    7 PM - 3 miles @ 10:10/M 
    Regret eating half a jojo chicken lemongrass and cereal
    in the evening.

September 18, 2016:
    11 AM - 1.5 miles @ 9:10/M 
    I blamed DOMS for the lack of running. Need to cut down
    on fast food during the weekends!

September 19, 2016:
    10 PM - 2 miles @ 9:05/M 

September 23, 2016:
    7:14 PM - 1 mile @ 8:47/M
    Sneaking in a mile before work.

September 24, 2016:
    10 AM - 1.5 miles @ 8:50/M
    I deserved that Chick Fil A chicken wrap

September 25, 2016:
    9:30 AM - 10 K @ 9:00/M
    Treated ourselves (George, Lina and I) to 
    Halal Guys and new Nike Clothes.

September 27, 2016:
    10:10 PM - 1 mile @ 7:54/M
    Running in the new lunars; feels like running on the moon.

October 1, 2016:
    12:30 PM - 3 miles @ 9:14/M
    Lunars are not good for long distance. 
    Thai tea at Pata cafe was amazing.

item.title: Sweet Crunchy Yogurt
item.description: When I was younger I never liked eating yogurt, healthy but an unbearable sour taste. However over the past year I decided to eat healthier so instead of eating dumplings and chow mei fun for breakfast (Thanks Mom & Dad for cooking breakfast for me!) I decided to give yogurt
item.dc:creator: Alan Chen
item.content:encoded:
When I was younger I never liked eating yogurt, healthy but an unbearable sour taste. However over the past year I decided to eat healthier so instead of eating dumplings and chow mei fun for breakfast (Thanks Mom & Dad for cooking breakfast for me!) I decided to give yogurt another go. I tried a few yogurts over the past few months, it took several tries to find a yogurt that I would love.

Initially I tried Pomegranate Chobani because my sister was eating at the time and I would stick to it for a few months but slowly my taste buds rejected the taste. This happened with a few yogurt brands: Nossa, StonyField and Siggi. Although I wouldn't mind eating the yogurts from time to time I couldn't stick to it. A few months later I stumble upon Wallaby Organic Whole Milk Vanilla Yogurt and I fell in love instantly. It's creamy, sweet, melts in your mouth like butter and tingles my taste buds. Combine with the right toppings, you will be sure to fall in love. This has become my breakfast a few times a week.

Here's the recipe, it's packed with healthy goodness. Be warned it's really simple :p.

Ingredients
  • 1 cup of Wallaby Organic Whole Milk Vanilla Yogurt (Flavor is up to you, I just like Vanilla)
  • Handful of Blueberries (Because you need your vitamins & antioxidants)
  • 2-3 Strawberries (More nutritional benefits and it complements the blueberry color)
  • Chia Seeds (Superfood. Packed with protein, fiber and the aztec warriors ate this)
  • Honey Sliced Almonds (It is good for the heart aka love)
Directions
  1. Diced up the strawberries into square pieces.
  2. Add 1 cup of yogurt into a bowl.
  3. Sprinkle the top of the yogurt with chai seeds.
  4. Place blueberries on one side of the bowl.
  5. Place strawberries on the other side of the bowl.
  6. Place the sliced almonds down the middle and around.
Bon Appetit

Does it look like the one in the picture above? If not, stir the bowl and eat up because looks don't matter, it's the taste that counts.

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Hi, I'm Alan. I'm super duper excited to start this blog. This platform will be a place where I share my thoughts, ideas and stories I have encounter and experienced in life. Hopefully I don't procrastinate! :D
